infos.value: That woman is an enemy commanding officer!?
I-I've heard about her! If I remember correctly, her name is—
It can't be... The commanding gunner of Rundall's third division, «Calorum»...!?
No doubt about it. That's the one they call Cruel Trigger... Lu'Cia!
Oh, my name has reached even the remote regions. What an honor.
So, tell the king of Hourne. Tell him that this fortress has been given up to Lu'Cia!
Hurry to the castle. We need reinforcements as soon as possible!
R-right!
Gwah!
A-are you okay!?
Don't worry. She just grazed me.
The Lu'Cia I've heard of wouldn't miss at this distance.
Well, it seems the Cruel Trigger isn't quite what she's been chalked up to be.
Hey, did you hear that?
They said Lady Lu'Cia isn't all that skilled!
To think they'd provoke Lady Lu'Cia... These Hourne chumps really are asking for it.
Asking for it...? What on earth are you talking about?
We're taking the fortress from here. However...
Understood. This lot...we'll keep them alive.
Keep us alive!? You plan to use us as hostages!?
Feigning ignorance, I see. That's what you were hoping for from the beginning, right? Gods...I'm jealous!
Jealous?
Naturally! You're lucky enough to be the subject of Lady Lu'Cia's torture.
Watch your mouth. It's not torture—it's playtime.
Playtime... Yeah, that has a nice ring to it...
If you say it like that, I want to be a Hourne soldier, too.
Well, then...let's begin. We'll enjoy this as much as we can.
We heard just a short while ago that a messenger arrived from a fortress on the national border of Rundall to the west.
You hear of things quickly.
The fortress fell after being attacked by Rundall's third division, «Calorum».
...Do not tell me that you are going west to that fortress...
I will command Hourne's second division, «Nitor». That is to be expected.
Hmm...
I did not reclaim «Nitor» from Glahz to be stationed in the castle.
"Reclaim"...?
«Nitor» is the force that my father established. Glahz snatched it away with foul trickery.
There is no proof of that claim. If the soldiers had any qualms about Glahz, they kept their silence.
B-but that bastard—!
I understand. I authorized the duel between you and Glahz for that reason.
I am anxious, Adelard.
Anxious...? How so?
You may have become the commander of «Nitor», but its soldiers are loyal to Glahz.
Leading «Nitor» alone on an expedition may put you in danger.
You are mistaken, King Robb. That is precisely what I am hoping will happen.
This is a good opportunity to educate the soldiers on who is the better commander.
